org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.impl.mtMessages

Class AsyncRequestMtImpl<RESPONSE_TYPE>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<java.lang.Object>
      • org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.impl.mtMessages.RequestMtImpl<RESPONSE_TYPE>
        • org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.impl.mtMessages.AsyncRequestMtImpl<RESPONSE_TYPE>
  • Type Parameters:
    RESPONSE_TYPE - The type of response.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Comparable<RequestImpl>, AsyncNativeRequest<RESPONSE_TYPE>, AsyncOperation<RESPONSE_TYPE>, AsyncResponseProcessor<RESPONSE_TYPE>, AsyncRequestImpl<RESPONSE_TYPE>, RequestImpl<RESPONSE_TYPE>, Operation<RESPONSE_TYPE>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AsyncRequestMtImplWithData

extends RequestMtImpl<RESPONSE_TYPE>
implements AsyncNativeRequest<RESPONSE_TYPE>
    Internal implementation of AsyncRequest.

      • AsyncRequestMtImpl

        public AsyncRequestMtImpl(AsyncOperation<RESPONSE_TYPE> _asyncOperation,
                  Reactor _targetReactor)
        Create an AsyncRequestMtImpl and bind it to its operation and target targetReactor.
        Parameters:
        _asyncOperation - The request being implemented.
        _targetReactor - The targetReactor where this AsyncRequest Objects is passed for processing. The thread owned by this targetReactor will process this AsyncRequest.

      • processAsyncException

        public void processAsyncException(java.lang.Exception _response)
        Returns an exception as a response instead of throwing it. But regardless of how a response is returned, if the response is an exception it is passed to the exception handler of the request that did the call or send on the request.
        Specified by:
        processAsyncException in interface AsyncRequestImpl<RESPONSE_TYPE>
        Parameters:
        _response - An exception.

      • setExceptionHandler

        public ExceptionHandler<RESPONSE_TYPE> setExceptionHandler(ExceptionHandler<RESPONSE_TYPE> _exceptionHandler)
        Replace the current ExceptionHandler with another.

        When an event or request message is processed by a targetReactor, the current exception handler is set to null. When a request is sent by a targetReactor, the current exception handler is saved in the outgoing message and restored when the response message is processed.

        Specified by:
        setExceptionHandler in interface AsyncRequestImpl<RESPONSE_TYPE>
        Parameters:
        _exceptionHandler - The exception handler to be used now. May be null if the default exception handler is to be used.
        Returns:
        The exception handler that was previously in effect, or null if the default exception handler was in effect.

      • getExceptionHandler

        public ExceptionHandler<RESPONSE_TYPE> getExceptionHandler()
        Returns the current exception handler.
        Returns:
        The current exception handler, or null.

      • send

        public <RT,RT2> RequestImpl<RT> send(SOp<RT> _sOp,
                            AsyncResponseProcessor<RT2> _dis,
                            RT2 _fixedResponse)
        Description copied from interface: AsyncRequestImpl
        Pass a request to its target and then replace its response value, providing the originating request is not canceled. Useful when you do not care about the actual response being passed back.
        Specified by:
        send in interface AsyncRequestImpl<RESPONSE_TYPE>
        Type Parameters:
        RT - The response value type.
        RT2 - The replacement value type.
        Parameters:
        _sOp - A synchronous operation, optionally used to define a SyncRequest.
        _dis - The callback to be invoked when a response value is received.
        _fixedResponse - The replacement value.

      • onCancel

        public void onCancel(AsyncRequestImpl _asyncRequestImpl)
        Description copied from interface: AsyncOperation
        An optional callback used to signal that the request has been canceled. This method must be thread-safe, as there is no constraint on which thread is used to call it. The default action of onCancel is to call cancelAll and, if the reactor is not a common reactor, sends a response of null via a bound response processor.
        Specified by:
        onCancel in interface AsyncOperation<RESPONSE_TYPE>
        Specified by:
        onCancel in interface AsyncRequestImpl<RESPONSE_TYPE>

      • onCancel

        public void onCancel()
        An optional callback used to signal that the request has been canceled. This method must be thread-safe, as there is no constraint on which thread is used to call it. The default action of onCancel is to call cancelAll and, if the reactor is not a common reactor, sends a response of null via a bound response processor.

      • onClose

        public void onClose(AsyncRequestImpl _asyncRequestImpl)
        Description copied from interface: AsyncOperation
        An optional callback used to signal that the request has been closed. This method must be thread-safe, as there is no constraint on which thread is used to call it. By default, onClose does nothing.
        Specified by:
        onClose in interface AsyncOperation<RESPONSE_TYPE>
        Specified by:
        onClose in interface AsyncRequestImpl<RESPONSE_TYPE>

      • onClose

        public void onClose()
        An optional callback used to signal that the request has been closed. This method must be thread-safe, as there is no constraint on which thread is used to call it. By default, onClose does nothing.
